item.title: One-pot Pumpkin Curry
item.description:
One-pot Pumpkin Curry

Might be good might be bad

Ingredients

  • 1 1⁄2 tbsp coconut oil
  • 1 medium shallot
  • 2 tbsp crushed ginger
  • 2 tbsp minced garlic
  • 1 small red chilli
  • 1 red capsicum, thinly sliced
  • 3 tbsp Thai curry paste
  • 3 1⁄2 cups peeled, cubed pumpkin
  • 400mL light coconut milk
  • 2 tbsp maple syrup
  • 1 tsp ground tumeric
  • 1 pinch sea salt
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 cup broccoli
  • 2 tbsp lemon juice
  • 2⁄3 cup roasted cashews

Method

Heat a large pot overm edium heat. Once hot, add coconut oil, shallot, ginger, garlic, and pepper. Saute for 2-3 minutes stirring frequently.

Add capsicum and curry paste. Cook for 2 minutes. Add pumpkin and cook for 2 minutes.

Add coconut milk, maple syrup, tumeric, sea salt, and soy sauce. Bring to a simmer.

Once simmering, slightly reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Add broccoli, lemon juice and cashes, and cover. Simmer for 3-4 minuets over low heat.

Optional: Scoop half the broth out and beldn until smooth.

item.title: Pumpkin and Goat’s Cheese Tart
item.description:
Pumpkin and Goat’s Cheese Tart

Makes two tarts, both of which are tasty. Best fresh, reheating is more questionable.

Ingredients

  • 2 sheets shortcrust pastry
  • 650g pumpkin
  • 150g goat’s cheese
  • 2 tbsp thyme
  • 4 eggs
  • 200g diced bacon
  • 2 tbsp maple syrup
  • 160mL thickened cream
  • 180mL milk

Method

Preheat oven to 200C. Lightly grease tart tin and line with pastry. Place in oven for 15 minutes, and cool. Press down with your hands to fully flatten the base.

Cook bacon and maple syrup and let cool.

Slice pumpkin into very thin slices. Spread bacon mixture onto base. Starting from the outside and working your way in, arrange pumpkin into pastry shell in a rosette pattern.

Scatter small/cubed bits of goat’s cheese and use some to wedge between some of the slices to separate slightly. Sprinkle with thyme.

Reduce oven to 170C. Whisk together egg, cream and milk. Pour over pumpkin and bake for 30 minutes, or until set.

item.title: Pumpkin Macaroni Cheese
item.description:
Pumpkin Macaroni Cheese

Uses a boatload of pumpkin with a boatload of nicely caramlised cheese.

Ingredients

  • 2 1⁄2 cups pumpkin (500g) chopped
  • 2 tablespoons oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 1 teaspoon dried sage

Sauce

  • 40g butter
  • 40g flour
  • 2 1⁄2 cups milk
  • 1⁄4 tsp nutmeg
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon pepper
  • 200g cheddar cheese
  • 25g parmesan cheese
  • 250g macaroni pasta, cooked and drained

Topping

  • 50g cheddar cheese
  • 50g mozzarella cheese
  • 25g parmesan cheese

Method

Preheat the oven to 190°C.

Chop up the pumpkin into chunks and place on a baking tray. Drizzle over the oil, salt, pepper, and ground sage, and coat evenly with your hands. Roast in the oven for 20 minutes. Once cooked leave to cool slightly and blend 1⁄3 of the pumpkin, set aside.

For the sauce, in a large ovenproof pan, melt the butter over a medium-low heat. Gradually mix in the flour to create a roux. Add the milk in 4-5 parts stirring well in between. Continue to stir and cook the sauce for a further 5-10 minutes or until the sauce is simmering and thickened. Stir in the ground nutmeg, garlic powder, pepper, cheddar, and Parmesan. Stir in the blended pumpkin. Stir in the remaining whole pumpkin and macaroni, mix until combined. Top with the cheddar, mozzarella, and Parmesan.

Grill for 10 minutes at 200°C (400°F) until the cheese is brown and bubbling.

item.title: Bacon-wrapped cauliflower
item.description:
Bacon-wrapped cauliflower

Yet another Keto meal to try and distract you from the fact you’re on a Keto diet.

Ingredients

  • 1/4 cup oil
  • 1/4 cup lemon juice
  • 1 cauliflower
  • 2 eggs, beaten
  • 4 spring onions
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 3/4 cup shredded cheese
  • 125g cream cheese
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/4 cup parmesan cheese
  • 500g bacon
  • 250g frozen chopped spinach.

Method

Boil 8 cups of water, oil, lemon juice and tbsp of salt in a large pot. Add cauliflower, weigh down with plate. Boil for 12 minutes and let cool.

Combine spinach, eggs, spring onions, crushed garlic, cheese, cream cheese, breadcrumbs and parmesan. Put in piping bag. Turn cauliflower upside down and pipe filling (get the muscles out). Turn cauliflower back over and wrap in bacon. You may need to hold in place with toothpicks.

Roast for 30 minutes at 230C.

item.title: Baked cod with herd crust
item.description:
Baked cod with herd crust

Very nice but can dry out the fish.

Ingredients

  • 3 tbsp vegetable oil
  • 125g breadcrumbs
  • 1 lime
  • 4 tbsp parsley
  • 2 tbsp chives
  • 1 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 1 tbsp ginger
  • Papper
  • 4 fillters firm white fish

Method

Mix together breadcrumbs, lime zest, chopped parsley and chives, mustard, ginger, oil and seasoning. Place the cod fillets onto a lined baking tray and sprinkle with lime juice. Divide the topping among the fillets, pressing firmly into the fish.

Bake for 20 minutes at 200C.

item.title: Bircher Oats
item.description:
Bircher Oats

Very nice to eat but also a pain to make.

Ingredients

  • 25g oats
  • 1 tbsp dried fruit
  • 6 tbsp apple juice
  • Berries
  • Splash of milk
  • Handful of almonds
  • Spoon of yoghurt

Method

Soak oats and dried fruit in apple juice overnight. Add the rest of the ingredients in the morning and hope your coffee has kicked in.

item.title: Breaded Lamb Chops
item.description:
Breaded Lamb Chops

A simple extension for an Aussie favourite

Ingredients

  • 2 tsp Dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp honey
  • 2 cloves garlic, crushed
  • 1 tbsp rosemary
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 8 lamb loin chops
  • 100g breadcrumbs

Method

Mix together mustard, honey, garlic, rosemary and 2tbsp of oil. Brush mixture over chops, then coat in breadcrumbs.

Grill or fry chops until tender.

item.title: Cauliflower Salad
item.description:
Cauliflower Salad

Pomegrante and Cauliflower make a surprisingly tasty combination.

Ingredients

  • 1 tsp cumin seeds
  • 1 tsp coriander seeds
  • 1 cauliflower
  • 2 tsp chopped garlic
  • 1 tsp salt
  • Pepper
  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 3 spring onions
  • 1 handful coriander leaves
  • 1 handful mint leaves
  • 1 pomegranate
  • 1 tbsp sunflower seeds
  • 1 tbsp pumpkin seeds
  • 1 tbsp toasted seasame seeds

Dressing

  • 3 tbsp lemon juice
  • 3 tbsp tahini
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 1 tsp honey
  • 130g Greek yoghurt

Method

Finely slice spring onion.

Toast cumin and coriander seeds for 1-2 minutes. Cut up cauliflower into small florets. Toss florets in a bowl with garlic, cumin and coriander seeds, salt, pepper and olive oil. Roast cauliflower on a baking tray for 20 minutes at 180C until lightly golden but still crunchy.

Whisk all dressing ingredients together and season. Toss the cauliflower and spring onions in the dressing. Add sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds, sesame seeds, and pomegranate.

item.title: Chickpea Salad
item.description:
Chickpea Salad

A tasty summer salad with chickpeas.

Ingredients

  • 1 can chickpeas
  • 1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
  • 1/2 cucumber, chopped
  • 1 red capsicum, roasted
  • 3 tomatoes, chopped
  • 2 tbsp parlsey
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 3 tbsp lemon juice
  • 2 tsp oil
  • 1/4 tsp salt

Method

Combine: chickpeas, red onion, cucumber, red capsicum, tomatoes, parsley and crushed garlic in a bowl.

Dressing: Combine lemon juice, oil and salt. Whip until emulsified.

Pour dressing over salad ingredients.

item.title: Dressed Herring
item.description:
Dressed Herring

A Russian favourite.

Ingredients

  • 1 packet Herring
  • 2 potatoes
  • 1 beetroot
  • 1 carrot
  • 1 onion
  • 4 eggs
  • Vinegar
  • Mayonnaise

Method

Unknown.

item.title: Fish Soup
item.description:
Fish Soup

Never actually made it

Ingredients

  • 2 onions
  • 2 potatoes
  • 1 carrot
  • Fresh dill
  • Fish heads and/or tails
  • Salt
  • Papper

Method

Put fish in pot. Add water. Add an onion, crossed, and half of the carrot. Boil for 30 minutes. Chop potato, remaining onion and other half of the carrot. Pour mixture through sieve. Add potato and chopped onion, and carrot. Separate fish from bones. Put back in and bring to the boil. Add salt and pepper. Once vegetables are cooked, add dill. Turn off heat, cover and let stand for 15 minutes.

item.title: French Onion Soup
item.description:
French Onion Soup

Very tasty, but you do have to find the right cheese.

Ingredients

  • 3 tbsp olive oil
  • 2 tbsp plain flour
  • 1 cup white whine
  • 1L beef stock
  • Bread
  • 80g butter
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard
  • 90g gruyere cheese
  • 1kg onions
  • 1 tbsp brown sugar

Method

Halve and slice onions. Heat butter and olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes or until onion is beginning to soften. Reduce heat to medium low. Cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes or until onion is very soft. Add sugar. Cook while stirring for 5 minutes until sugar dissolves and coats onion. Add flour and cook or 1 minute. Gradually stir in wine. Simmer for 3 to 4 minutes or until wine reduces by half and mixture is thick. Add stock. Cover, bring to simmer and cook on medium heat for 5 minutes or until soup has thickened slightly.

Toast one side of bread. Butter th e reverse side and add a small amount of mustard and grated cheese. Grill for 1 to 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

item.title: Keto Broccoli Salad
item.description:
Keto Broccoli Salad

Bacony, and mayonaissey. If you’re crazy enough to be on Keto this might take your mind off of it.

Ingredients

  • 2 heads broccoli
  • 1/2 cup cheese
  • 1/4 red onion
  • 3 slices bacon
  • 2 tbsp chives
  • 1/4 cup toasted sliced almonds

Dressing

  • 2/3 cup mayonaisse
  • 3 tbsp apple cider vinegar
  • 1 tbsp Dijon mustard

Method

Boil broccoli florets in salt water for 1-2 minutes. Combine dressing ingredients and season.

Grill or fry bacon until crispy and crumble/chop. Mix everyhing in a bowl and toss to combine.

item.title: Lemon Curd
item.description:
Lemon Curd

A good way to use up excess egg yolks. And butter.

Ingredients

  • 3 lemons
  • 3/4 cup sugar
  • 110g butter
  • 5 egg yolks
  • 1/4 tsp salt

Method

Zest 3 lemons and gather 1/2 cup lemon juice. Combine sugar, lemon zest, egg yolks, lemon juice and salt.

heat over very low heat, whisking constantly. At approximately 150F, add butter. Heat to 170F and the curd has thickened.

Strain and store.

item.title: Lemongrass and Ginger Fish Parcels
item.description:
Lemongrass and Ginger Fish Parcels

Sounds weird, but does work. But make sure the fish is good.

Ingredients

  • 2 lemongrass stalks
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 5cm piece of ginger
  • 2 tsp seasame oil
  • 1/4 cup soy sauce
  • 1 red capsicum
  • 600g firm white fish
  • 4 spring onions

Method

Finely chop lemongrass, combine with crushed garlic, grated ginger, sesame oil and soy sauce in a dish. Season. Add fish and turn to coat. Finely slice capsicum and divide spring onions into 4 portions that will fit in the parcel.

Cut 4 x 20cm pieces of baking paper

Place 1/4 of the fish on a sheet of paper. Top with 1/4 of the onion and capcisum. Spoon over a little of the sauce. Fold over the baking paper and tie with kitchen string. Place on a baking tray, and repeat for remaining 3 parcels.

Bake for 15 to 20 minutes at 200C

item.title: Macaroons
item.description:
Macaroons

The french classic.

Ingredients

  • 100g almond meal
  • 180g icing sugar
  • 100g egg whites
  • 1/4 tsp cream of tartar
  • 35g castor sugar

Method

Separate egg whites 24h before - store in a lightly covered bowl.

Beat egg whites and cream of tartar on medium speed until foamy. Add castor sugar. Beat until stiff peaks. In three additions, sift the ground almonds and sugar into the meringue. Fold the mixture until it is of lava consistency. Pipe onto trays and tap to remove air bubbles.

Leave to sit for 30m. Bake at 16 degrees for 15m.

The macaroon should lift freely from the parchment. Fill with cream of choice.

Store in refrigerator

item.title: Meatballs
item.description:
Meatballs

Don’t remember making these.

Ingredients

  • 500g beef mince
  • 1 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1 tbsp dried parsley
  • 1 tbsp parmesan
  • 1/4 tsp pepper
  • pinch garlic powder
  • 1 egg

Method

Combine all ingredients and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Bake for 20 minutes at 180C.

item.title: Moroccan Beef
item.description:
Moroccan Beef

From memory this was quite sweet.

Ingredients

  • 1 tsp oil
  • 600g diced beef
  • 1 onion
  • 3 carrots
  • 2 cloves garlic
  • 1 tin tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp middle eastern spice
  • 1 1/2 cups cold water
  • 1/2 cup raisins
  • 1/3 cup pearl barley

Method

Chop onion and carrot. Heat oil in a pan. Brown beef and add to slow cooker. Cook onion and carrot for five minutes. Add garlic, middle eastern spice and cook for 1 minute. Add to slow cooker. Add tomatoes and cold water to slow cooker. Cook for 4 hours. Add raisins, pearl barley and 1 cup of water. Cook for a further 2 hours.

item.title: Mushroom Buckwheat Risotto
item.description:
Mushroom Buckwheat Risotto

Yet another Keto meal to try and distract you from the fact you’re on a Keto diet.

Ingredients

  • 1/3 cup raw buckwheat
  • 1/2 onion
  • 1 clove garlic
  • 2 cups hot vegetable stock
  • 1/2 cup white wine
  • 1/3 cup dried shiitake mushrooms
  • 2 large portobello mushrooms
  • 2 tbsp thyme
  • 2 tbsp oregano
  • 1/2 cup chopped parsley
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1/3 cup grated parmesan
  • Large spoon of creamy chevre
  • Salt & pepper

Method

Put shiitake mushrooms in 1/3 cup boiling water and leave to infuse. Heat up the stock. Saute onion and garlic in olive oil. Add buckwheat and stir for 2-3 minutes. Add wine, once absorbed start adding stock, one ladel at a time. Add shiitake mushrooms.

Fry portobello mushrooms in oil with oregano & thyme (10-15 minutes).

Add parsley, parmesan & liquid from shiitake to buckwheat. Add salt and pepper, let stand for 2 minutse. Add portobello. Serve with goats cheese.

item.title: Mushroom Meatballs
item.description:
Mushroom Meatballs

One of my favourites.

Ingredients

  • 1 tbsp oil
  • 500g white mushrooms
  • Pinch salt
  • 1 tbsp butter
  • 1/2 cup onion
  • 4 garlic cloves
  • 1/2 cup oats
  • 30g parmesan
  • 1/2 cup breadcrumbs
  • 1/4 cup flat-leaf parsley
  • 2 eggs
  • 1 tsp salt
  • 1 pinch cayenne pepper
  • 1 pinch dried oregano

Method

Chop mushrooms and finely chop onion. Heat oil over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and salt, and cook until liquid evaporated. Stir in butter. Reduce heat to mdium and cook until golden brown (5 minutes).

Stir in onion and cook until translucent (5 minutes). Remove from heat and stir in garlic. Transfer to bowl.

Mix in oats and parmesan. Add breadcrumbs, parsley and 1 egg, salt, pepper, cayenne and oregano. Mix with fork until crumbly. Add another egg. Refrigerate overnight.

Form meatballs on a tray. Bake for 12-15 minutes at 230C.
